intro: Trachystoma aphanoneurum var. trichocarpum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It features small, fleshy, blue-green leaves that are densely packed along its prostrate stems. The plant produces tiny, white or pale blue flowers in clusters during the cooler months. Its succulent leaves help it store water, adapting it to dry environments. It is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in xeriscaping.
